title: ‘Hangmen’ Review: An Honorable Death
sub_head: Martin McDonagh’s dark comedy follows an executioner whose preferred means of plying his trade has been outlawed.
body:
New York
For Harry (David Threlfall), the likably pompous central character in Martin McDonagh’s “Hangmen,” executing people wasn’t just a living. It was a noble calling. Putting convicts to death by means of a rope around the neck was, he firmly believes, superior to the more barbaric methods used in other countries.
